body: I'm honestly not sure if this can be automigrated, given that the setups could be vastly different. But we certainly could add a documentation entry to https://svelte.dev/docs/v4-migration-guide and link to it from the migration script - it's not strictly a breaking change within Svelte itself, but related to it.

issue.title: fix: note old eslint plugin deprecation
issue.body:
closes #10242

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [ ] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [ ] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [ ] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. Changesets that add features should be `minor` and those that fix bugs should be `patch`. Please prefix changeset messages with `feat:`, `fix:`, or `chore:`.

issue.title: More help modals
issue.body:
Add all the text for the help modals of the full version

Also includes fixes for the CI as recommended by https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/10242

issue.title: Svelte 4 Generic Syntax in docs

repository.name: sveltekit-superforms
repository.description: Making SvelteKit forms a pleasure to use!

issue.body:
Hi,

I experimented the guide about [componentization](https://superforms.rocks/components), once I made my way through (very helpful guide btw, thanks a lot). I had an issue with ESLint. ESlint was not happy about this : `type T = $$Generic<AnyZodObject>;`, in the `TextField.svelte` component.

After doing some research, I think (I'm not a Svelte pro yet!) that this is the old way of defining generics. The new version would be within the script tag `<script lang="ts" generics="T extends AnyZodObject">`. But my ESLint is not happier by this way of defining the generic.

I would be happy to make a PR to edit the documentation, but I'd like to have my take validated first.

Thanks in advance.

----

GitHub issues related to this syntax issues : 
https://github.com/sveltejs/eslint-plugin-svelte3/issues/127
https://github.com/sveltejs/svelte-eslint-parser/issues/306
https://github.com/sveltejs/eslint-plugin-svelte/issues/521 <-- much recent and interesting

issue.title: feat: upgrade to prettier 3 and prettier-plugin-svelte 3
issue.body:
This will give users the new versions via `create-svelte`. The rest of the change is internal

closes #10751
closes https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/10716
